comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: I gather this pic would have been taken from the Australia Hotel (completed ca. mid 1891) www.flickr.com/photos/24785917@N03/3042605328/in/photolis... see comments here www.flickr.com/photos/24785917@N03/2554620243/in/photolis......note the Henry King pics from the PHM Collection also taken from the Australia Hotel which [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] ferreted out...particularly this one www.powerhousemuseum.com/collection/database/?irn=30549 Lawler's Emporium, 608 George St, was built in 1886-1887 news.google.com/newspapers?id=u8JPAAAAIBAJ&sjid=U5MDA... it was destroyed by fire on 1/9/1894 trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/71263718 ...source re Tivoli Theatre, see Leann Richards' excellent article aussietheatre.com.au/features/venue-histories/the-tivoli-... ... possible date range for this pic ca. February 1893 - late August 1894... These Fred Hardie pics are really stunning! Looks as though many of them might have been taken at about the same time...if so, then it might be possible to narrow the date range considerably...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] They are a great series indeed!  There are a couple (so far) i think are definitely early 1893 (rather than 1892 - really splitting hairs here!) - 

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw/9023627356/]

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: ! (a few hours later) I was initially so mesmerised by the pics I didn't notice the date range 1892-1893 is in fact indicated in the caption...moths have similar problems with bright lights...my apologies!
